ticket.title: Add release build job to CI workflow

out_of_scope: Adding release build artifacts to releases

steps: Add new job 'build' after existing jobs
Configure steps: checkout, toolchain, protoc, cache, build
Verify CI workflow syntax is valid
Test that release build completes successfully

criteria: Release build passes on PR CI

notes.rationale:
Current CI compiles implicitly through clippy and test jobs, but no explicit
release build is performed. Release builds with optimizations can surface bugs
not caught in debug builds:
- Overflow checks are disabled in release (unless explicitly enabled)
- Some UB may only manifest with optimizations
- Link errors may differ between debug and release

Adding an explicit release build job ensures the codebase compiles correctly
with release optimizations applied.
notes.ci_job_definition:
```yaml
build:
  name: Release Build
  runs-on: ubuntu-24.04
  steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    - uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@nightly
    - name: Install protoc
      run: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y protobuf-compiler
    - uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
    - run: cargo build --workspace --release
```
